weapons.name: Cattleman Revolver

acquisition.notes: Arthur's default revolver

weapons.communityNotes: Reliable all-rounder. Fast reload makes it forgiving in combat. Good for early game dual-wielding.

weapons.name: Double-Action Revolver
weapons.communityNotes: Highest fire rate revolver but weakest damage. Best for spray-and-pray style.

weapons.name: Schofield Revolver

acquisition.notes: Steal from weapon case during robbery

weapons.communityNotes: Best overall revolver for accuracy and damage. Slower but hits harder than Cattleman.

weapons.name: LeMat Revolver

acquisition.notes: Available after 'The Gilded Cage' mission

weapons.communityNotes: Unique hybrid revolver/shotgun. 9-round capacity plus secondary shotgun barrel. Highest revolver damage but slowest reload.

weapons.name: Navy Revolver

acquisition.notes: Originally Red Dead Online exclusive, added to Story Mode

weapons.communityNotes: Excellent balance of damage and accuracy. Strong alternative to Schofield.

weapons.name: Flaco's Revolver

acquisition.notes: Defeat Flaco Hernandez in 'The Noblest of Men, and a Woman' stranger mission. Loot from body - MISSABLE

weapons.communityNotes: Unique silver revolver with sugar skull engraving and ivory grips. Good early dual-wield option.

weapons.name: Granger's Revolver

acquisition.notes: Defeat Emmet Granger in 'The Noblest of Men, and a Woman' stranger mission. Loot from body - MISSABLE

weapons.communityNotes: Unique Cattleman variant with fast fire rate. Part of the gunslinger questline.

weapons.name: Calloway's Revolver

acquisition.notes: Obtained at end of 'The Noblest of Men, and a Woman' gunslinger questline

weapons.communityNotes: Ornate Schofield variant. Reward for completing all gunslinger duels.

weapons.name: Otis Miller's Revolver

acquisition.location: Rattlesnake Hollow cave, Cholla Springs (New Austin)
acquisition.notes: Found in chest as part of treasure hunt. Requires completing all treasure maps.

weapons.communityNotes: Powerful unique Schofield. Only available in Epilogue.

weapons.name: Algernon's Revolver

acquisition.location: Algernon Wasp's house, north of Saint Denis
acquisition.notes: Reward for completing all 'Duchesses and Other Animals' requests

weapons.communityNotes: Gold-plated Double-Action variant. Requires extensive flower/feather collecting.

weapons.name: Micah's Revolver

acquisition.notes: Found on frozen corpse after 'American Venom' mission

weapons.communityNotes: Distinctive revolver with best range of any revolver. Only available post-story.

weapons.name: Volcanic Pistol
weapons.communityNotes: Highest damage pistol, almost rifle-like. Slow fire rate but devastating per shot.

weapons.name: Semi-Automatic Pistol
weapons.communityNotes: Fastest firing sidearm. Low damage but magazine fed for quick reloads. Great for Dead Eye spam.

weapons.name: Mauser Pistol

acquisition.notes: Also can be obtained from Angelo Bronte's men in Chapter 4

weapons.communityNotes: Slightly more damage than Semi-Auto with 10-round magazine. Best pistol for capacity.

weapons.name: M1899 Pistol

acquisition.notes: Available after 'The Battle of Shady Belle'. Originally PC exclusive.

weapons.communityNotes: Modern semi-auto pistol. Balanced stats between Semi-Auto and Mauser.

weapons.name: Midnight's Pistol

acquisition.notes: Defeat Billy Midnight in 'The Noblest of Men, and a Woman' stranger mission - MISSABLE

weapons.communityNotes: Gold-plated Mauser available very early. One of the best early-game acquisitions. Don't forget to loot!

weapons.name: Carbine Repeater

acquisition.notes: Given during story missions

weapons.communityNotes: Solid starting repeater. Versatile but outclassed by Lancaster in accuracy.

weapons.name: Lancaster Repeater

acquisition.notes: Obtained automatically during mission

weapons.communityNotes: Best all-around weapon in the game. Exceptional accuracy with 14-round capacity. Most players' main weapon.

weapons.name: Litchfield Repeater

acquisition.notes: Obtained automatically during mission

weapons.communityNotes: Highest damage repeater with 16-round capacity. Less accurate than Lancaster but hits harder.

weapons.name: Evans Repeater

acquisition.notes: Originally PC exclusive, added to all platforms

weapons.communityNotes: Massive 26-round capacity. Lower damage but rarely need to reload. Great for prolonged fights.

weapons.name: Varmint Rifle
weapons.communityNotes: Essential for hunting small game. Very accurate but weak against humans. Use .22 ammo.

weapons.name: Springfield Rifle
weapons.communityNotes: Single-shot rifle with excellent damage and range. Great for hunting medium/large game.

weapons.name: Bolt Action Rifle

acquisition.notes: Obtained automatically during mission

weapons.communityNotes: Excellent combat rifle. 5-round magazine balances power and practicality. Great all-rounder.

weapons.name: Rolling Block Rifle
weapons.communityNotes: Powerful single-shot sniper. Highest damage rifle but slow to reload. Best for long range.

weapons.name: Rare Rolling Block Rifle

acquisition.location: Six Point Cabin, during 'Magicians for Sport' mission
acquisition.notes: Found in shed where sniper was hiding - MISSABLE

weapons.communityNotes: Unique variant with brass fittings. Identical stats to standard version.

weapons.name: Carcano Rifle

acquisition.notes: Available after 'Goodbye, Dear Friend' mission

weapons.communityNotes: Best sniper rifle. 6-round magazine allows follow-up shots. Slightly less damage than Rolling Block but much more practical.

weapons.name: Elephant Rifle

acquisition.notes: Added post-launch

weapons.communityNotes: Massive stopping power, knocks Arthur back when firing. Overkill for most situations but fun.

weapons.name: Double-Barreled Shotgun
weapons.communityNotes: Classic break-action shotgun. Only 2 shots but devastating up close.

weapons.name: Rare Shotgun

acquisition.notes: Kill hermit at cabin and loot. Unique brass and wood engravings.

weapons.communityNotes: Beautiful unique shotgun. Slightly better stats than standard Double-Barrel. Worth the trip.

weapons.name: Sawed-Off Shotgun

acquisition.notes: Given during story missions

weapons.communityNotes: Can be dual-wielded! Highest shotgun damage but shortest range. Devastating in close quarters.

weapons.name: Pump-Action Shotgun
weapons.communityNotes: Best all-around shotgun. 5-round capacity with solid damage. Reliable workhorse.

weapons.name: Semi-Auto Shotgun
weapons.communityNotes: Fastest firing shotgun. Lower damage per shot but can unload quickly.

weapons.name: Repeating Shotgun
weapons.communityNotes: Lever-action shotgun with 6-round capacity. Good balance of fire rate and power.

weapons.name: Bow

acquisition.notes: Essential for silent hunting

weapons.communityNotes: Silent weapon, essential for hunting. Different arrow types drastically change effectiveness. Cannot be upgraded.

weapons.name: Hunting Knife

acquisition.notes: Used for skinning and stealth kills

weapons.communityNotes: Essential tool for skinning animals. Used for stealth kills from behind.

weapons.name: Machete

acquisition.notes: Found during 'A Fine Night For It' stranger mission

weapons.communityNotes: Longer reach than knife. Good for melee combat.

weapons.name: Hatchet

acquisition.notes: Can also be thrown

weapons.communityNotes: Versatile melee/throwing weapon. Many unique variants found throughout the world.

weapons.name: Cleaver
weapons.communityNotes: Heavy melee weapon. Brutal but slow.

weapons.name: Broken Pirate Sword

acquisition.location: Wrecked boat south of Saint Denis bridge
acquisition.notes: On skeleton in shipwreck

weapons.communityNotes: Unique cosmetic melee weapon. Fun but not practical.

weapons.name: Civil War Knife

acquisition.location: Fort Brennand basement, southwest of Van Horn
acquisition.notes: On skeleton in basement

weapons.communityNotes: Historic unique knife. Cosmetic variant.

weapons.name: Ornate Dagger

acquisition.notes: Find 5 vampire markings around Saint Denis, then encounter vampire at midnight in marked alley

weapons.communityNotes: Reward from killing the Saint Denis vampire. One of the game's hidden encounters.

weapons.name: Jawbone Knife

acquisition.notes: Reward for finding all 30 dinosaur bones

weapons.communityNotes: Made from dinosaur jawbone. Reward for completing paleontology collection.

weapons.name: Viking Hatchet

acquisition.notes: In viking burial site with ancient helmet

weapons.communityNotes: Ancient hatchet from viking burial. Near the tomb with the ancient viking helmet.

weapons.name: Ancient Tomahawk

acquisition.location: Calumet Ravine, east of Wapiti Indian Reservation
acquisition.notes: Stuck in archery target

weapons.communityNotes: Stone-age tomahawk. Higher damage than regular tomahawk.

weapons.name: Throwing Knife

acquisition.notes: Can carry up to 8

weapons.communityNotes: Silent ranged weapon. Great for stealth.

weapons.name: Tomahawk

acquisition.notes: Can carry up to 4

weapons.communityNotes: Heavier than throwing knife, more damage but less accurate.

weapons.name: Dynamite

acquisition.notes: Also found throughout world

weapons.communityNotes: Explosive. Great for groups of enemies and certain missions.

weapons.name: Fire Bottle

acquisition.notes: Also craftable

weapons.communityNotes: Molotov cocktail. Sets area on fire, causing damage over time.

weapons.name: Lasso

acquisition.notes: Essential for capturing horses and bounties

weapons.communityNotes: Non-lethal. Used to capture horses, hogtie enemies, and complete bounty missions.

improved_rifling.name: Improved Rifling
improved_rifling.description: Increases bullet velocity for better range

longer_barrel.name: Longer Barrel
longer_barrel.description: Extends effective range and improves accuracy

improved_sights.name: Improved Sights
improved_sights.description: Better iron sights for improved accuracy

statsScale.description: All stats are on a 0-4.0 scale
